They also support local organizations, including Toys for Tots, Wounded Warriors, & more. Commander Lindsey & the DAV have changed the lives of so many vets. Join me in thanking him for his continued service to our community, our country, & especially our veterans. (5/5)

Commander Lindsey and the Doylestown DAV work day-in & day-out to provide free, professional assistance, outreach programs, support for the transition from military to civilian life, & advocate for disabled veterans and their families at the local, state, & federal level. (4/5)

Through his tireless and inspirational leadership, the Doylestown DAV has exponentially grown and is continuing the tradition of its founders. Their mission is to ensure our hero veterans and their families can access all the benefits available to them. (3/5)

After more than 2 decades, as members aged, the group saw a drastic change in their numbers. Determined to keep the organization & its important work alive, in ‚Äò15, Commander Lindsey, an Iraq War vet, stepped up to serve once more to ensure the chapter‚Äôs continued survival. (2/5)

I recently introduced the Vet CENTERS for Mental Health Act, which will expand VA Vet Centers in communities that need it most and ensure that our hero veterans have access to adequate and affordable health care, including critical mental health services. https://t.co/uUjAYR0Rb5
